Key Arguments: The bill exempts government communication from being considered misinformation or disinformation, which is seen as a way to suppress speech that undermines government claims.
The legislation is perceived as a tool for corruption and manipulation by those in power.
The ACMA is questioned whether it will act as an independent watchdog or a compliant entity to the government.
Main Themes: Concerns about government overreach and potential for abuse of power
Notable Quotes: Any and all persons voting in support of this Bill are the persons who are petrified of being exposed by the truth of their complicity to bend true facts to their corruption agendas.
This enforces a regime of suppression of any speech on social media that undermines government claims. Or in other words fascism.
Consequently this Bill must be placed where it belongs, IN THE BIN to be destroyed.
